intro: Taraxacum acroschistum, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, spoon-shaped, and covered with fine hairs, while the flower heads consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Taraxacum acroschistum is often found in mountain meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
